{{ddcl|header=locale|1=
template&lt; 
    class CharT,

&gt; class time_put;
}}

Class template {{tt|std::time_put}} encapsulates date and time formatting rules. The I/O manipulator {{lc|std::put_time}} uses the {{tt|std::time_put}} facet of the I/O stream's locale to generate text representation of an {{lc|std::tm}} object.

{{inheritance diagram/std-time_put}}

If a {{tt|std::time_put}} specialization is not guaranteed to be provided by the standard library (see below), the behaviors of its {{lc|put()}} and {{lc|do_put()}} are not guaranteed as specified.

===Specializations===
The standard library is guaranteed to provide the following specializations (they are {{rlp|locale|required to be implemented by any locale object}}):
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc header|locale}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|std::time_put&lt;char&gt;}}|creates narrow string representations of date and time}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|std::time_put&lt;wchar_t&gt;}}|creates wide string representations of date and time}}
{{dsc end}}

In addition, the standard library is also guaranteed to provide every specialization that satisfies the following type requirements:
* {{tt|CharT}} is one of {{c/core|char}} and {{c/core|wchar_t}}, and
* {{tt|OutputIt}} must meet the requirements of {{named req|OutputIterator}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;codecvt&gt;
#include &lt;ctime&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::time_t t = std::time(nullptr);
    std::wbuffer_convert&lt;std::codecvt_utf8&lt;wchar_t&gt;&gt; conv(std::cout.rdbuf());
    std::wostream out(&amp;conv);
    out.imbue(std::locale("ja_JP.utf8"));
    
    // this I/O manipulator std::put_time uses std::time_put&lt;wchar_t&gt;
    out &lt;&lt; std::put_time(std::localtime(&amp;t), L"%A %c") &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
水曜日 2011年11月09日 12時32分05秒
}}
